title: Pope discloses he has cataracts, expects operation next year
text:
March 29, 2018 / 6:35 PM / Updated an hour ago Pope discloses he has cataracts, expects operation next year Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ROME (Reuters) - Pope Francis on Thursday disclosed that he had cataracts and expects to have an operation next year. FILE PHOTO: Pope Francis reacts as he arrives to lead the Wednesday general audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican, March 21, 2018. REUTERS/Tony Gentile/File Photo 
During a visit to a Rome prison, Francis, 81, responded to words by the institution’s director about the need to be “far-sighted” about the rehabilitation of inmates. 
“This is good,” the pope said. “Because at my age, for example, cataracts arrive and one does not see reality well. Next year we will have to have an operation.” 
Cataracts are a clouding of the eyes’ natural lens and are common in elderly people. Surgery to correct them is considered routine and has a very high rate of success. 
The pope has not been hospitalised since his election as Roman Catholic leader in 2013 and appears to be in overall good health. FILE PHOTO: Pope Francis touches his skull cap during the Wednesday general audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican, March 14, 2018. REUTERS/Remo Casilli/File Photo Reporting by Philip Pullella; Editing by Robin Pomeroy
